text:
DEPARTMENT OF
HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE
OFFICE OF EDUCATION
WASHINGTON 25, D.C.
April 19, 1963
Miss Marion Corwell
Associate Director
Dearborn Public Schools
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Marion:
I enjoyed your letter and appreciate your friendly welcome
to an old committee member. I dislike alibis and I won't
bore you with all of the reasons why I have not been able
to meet your deadline date for ideas about compiling our
NAEB SPEAKER'S DIRECTORY. The past two weeks have just
been too demanding and yours was one assignment which I put
aside. Now I am leaving for DAVI in Denver where I will be
most of next week. After that you will be in Philadelphia
at AWRT. I, unfortunately, am going to have to miss it but
while you are conventioning I will do my best to prepare
something and have it in your mail by the time you return
to Dearborn. I hope to be at the Columbus Institute and
think by all means that we ought to get our committee to plan
to meet there.
With best wishes, I am,
(Mrs.) Gertrude G. Broderick
Educational Media Specialist
